alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:43AM EDT until May 04 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Cumberland, Gloucester, and Salem. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM EDT, the stream gauge on the Maurice River at Norma was above flood stage. Flooding is ongoing across portions of the warned area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain fell over the weekend. - For Maurice River at Norma: At 11:15am the stage was 4.15 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
